ISSUE.TITLE: Bug: create a date field, but the database corresponding type is varchar
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this ### Steps to reproduce ? db: mysql 5.7.33 version: 0.109.7 1. create a date field ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/16935251/9bf2c0c8-b03f-4bef-83b6-a4da6d2662de) 2. but in the database, the type is varchar ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/16935251/ae5c7900-3e23-4341-bf4e-63e279aa3a70) ### Desired Behavior in the database, the type is also date ### Project Details Node: **v16.20.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.109.7** ### Attachments _No response_
